paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: In 1978 the Portuguese group led by Pedro Costa demonstrated that Familial Amyloid Polyneuropathy was caused by the protein transthyretin through a classical mechanism of autosomal dominant transmission.

functional_data.summary: The V30M mutation is known to destabilize the TTR tetramer, leading to amyloid formation.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on familial segregation.
variants.additional_notes: The V30M mutation is one of the most studied variants in TTR amyloidosis.
key_quotes: In 1978 the Portuguese group led by Pedro Costa demonstrated that Familial Amyloid Polyneuropathy was caused by the protein transthyretin.

individual_records.phenotype_details: No symptoms of amyloidosis despite carrying the V30M mutation.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Demonstration that the presence of protomers with T119M has a stabilizing effect on the tetramer is a strong evidence in favor of the hypothesis that misfolding is at the basis of the disease.

functional_data.summary: The T119M mutation stabilizes the TTR tetramer, providing protection against amyloidosis.

variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on protective effect observed.
variants.additional_notes: The T119M mutation is known to provide a protective effect against the amyloidogenic V30M mutation.
key_quotes: Demonstration that the presence of protomers with T119M has a stabilizing effect on the tetramer is a strong evidence in favor of the hypothesis that misfolding is at the basis of the disease.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for TTR variants were extracted successfully.
